item.title: Apple Platform Security
item.description: Applications or even OS itself doesn’t know the keys that are protected by Secure Enclave. OS only sees Keychain, but the Security Enclave is separated.

item.title: Randomness
item.description: In this article I am assembling information about randomness in computer science: how it is implemented, used and how it can be attacked.

item.title: Diffie-Hellman Key Exchange
item.description: I’ve written this article while I was untanging RSA and Deffie Hellman inside my head. What I need to stree right here, in the article description, the main difference between them is the Deffie Hellman is NOT a encryption algorithm!

item.title: RSA
item.description: To my utter embarrassment I had to admit that I’ve recently realized I didn’t remember how the RSA worked….

item.title: AES
item.description: This is the next generation. 128-bit blocks, 128,192, 256 keys. It takes too much time to brute force.

item.title: Caesar's Cipher
item.description: In this article, I’m dissecting a very well-known (and that’s why not advisable to be used) cryptographic algorithm which is better known for IT tribe as “ROT13”.

item.title: DES
item.description: DES - Symmetric. Data Encryption Standard. NIST 1993. 56 bit key, 64-bit plaintext input (blocks). How secure?

item.title: One-time Pad
item.description: One-time pad is like a Viginear cypher but with the key the length of the cypher text.

item.title: iOS Keychain
item.description: In this article I’m trying to study how keychain works. Metaphor There once lived a monkey üêí George.
